From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>

As Tavatron waited for Dinobot her gaze seemed to wander across the horizon. 
Dawn had just broken, something she had never quite grown used to. The 
majority of her life had been spent on space colonies populated with 
artificial lights, food, and sometimes even intelligence. The vast colonies 
had spanned great distances and harbored many raw materials in their day, 
but have since fallen into disrepair and disuse many cycles ago.

She had been a guard, that much Tavatron could remember. The rest, however, 
was extremely hazy. It was odd, she could never seem to remember much of her 
past beyond what had just happened. It bothered her considerably. There were 
a few choice moments that, no matter how much time passed, she would never 
forget. With a heavy sigh Tavatron continued to brush the heavier amounts of 
dirt and dried mud from her fur. She could barely see her armor beneath the 
seemingly growing amounts of dust and grime. She greatly disliked looking 
and feeling like she had been run over by a tank �bot.

As Dinobot made his way toward her and Foxfinger she began to ponder his 
question. She knew it wasn�t one he expected an answer to, neither would 
she. Still, sometimes it helped if one was offered some sort of an 
explanation. There was still one thing she couldn�t figure out, why did he 
want to die? Wasn�t he a warrior, and as such bound by his honor, as 
Tavatron was by hers, to seek an honorable death? It confused her to no 
ends, perhaps someday he would see fit to enlighten her. She fell in step 
beside him as they made their way to the CF, she in robot mode and he in 
beast mode:

"I suspect that you already know the answer, it is just a matter of coming 
to terms with it."
